protocol_name: Detection of OXA-48-like, KPC and NDM carbapenemases directly from blood culture bottles using an immunochromatographic assay
protocol_name_html: Detection of OXA-48-like, KPC and NDM carbapenemases directly from blood culture bottles using an immunochromatographic assay
description: Bloodstream infections caused by carbapenemase-producing Enterobacteriaceae (CPE) are associated with treatment failure and increased mortality. Detection of CPE from blood cultures (BC) by standard methods takes 16-72 hours, which can delay the initiation of appropriate antimicrobial therapy and compromise patient outcome. We developed and evaluated a new method for the rapid detection of carbapenemases directly from positive BC using a new multiplex immunochromatographic test (ICT), the RESIST‑3 O.K.N. ICT® (Coris BioConcept, Gembloux, Belgium). It was originally developed for the detection of OXA-48-like, KPC and NDM carbapenemases from bacteria grown on solid media.
before_start:
Prepare

10% SDS (can be stored for several weeks, but make sure that it has not crystallized)

0.5 M ZnSO4 (can be stored for months)

 

Other reagents required:

double distilled water ddH20

RESIST-3 O.K.N. ICT (Coris BioConcept, Gembloux, Belgium)

1.5 ml reaction tubes (e.g. Eppendorf)
protocol_affiliation: University of Cologne, Institute for Medical Microbiology, Immunology and Hygiene
manuscript_citation: Hamprecht A, Vehreschild JJ, Seifert H, Saleh A (2018) Rapid detection of NDM, KPC and OXA-48 carbapenemases directly from positive blood cultures using a new multiplex immunochromatographic assay. PLoS ONE 13(9): e0204157. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0204157
keywords: Carbapenemase, Immunochromatographic assay, Blood culture, NDM, OXA-48, KPC, zinc, Coris, CPE, CRE

authors_list.name: Axel Hamprecht
authors_list.affiliation: University of Cologne, Institute for Medical Microbiology, Immunology and Hygiene

authors_list.name: Ahmad Saleh
authors_list.affiliation: University of Cologne, Institute for Medical Microbiology, Immunology and Hygiene

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"7d5t1","text":"Draw 1-3 ml of blood culture fluid from blood culture bottles that have been flagged positive by the blood culture automate (e.g. BD Bactex FX) and that contain Gram-negative bacilli on Gram-stain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ccp7","text":"Add 1 ml of blood culture fluid in a 1.5 ml reaction tube (e.g. Eppendorf).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lr84","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f48oe","text":"Add 200 \u00b5l of 10% SDS to the reaction tube, invert and vortex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"mui6","text":"Incubate for 5 min. at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bosk","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min @ 13 000 g in a conventional microcentrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"44v0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqa2j","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"efnrs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aq6to","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"3pstg","text":"After centrifugation, a white pellet should be visible at the bottom of the reaction tube (see picture).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qphd","text":"This pellet should not be smaller than what is shown in the picture. If the pellet is smaller, use a larger volume of blood culture fluid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dav30","text":"Gently remove the supernatant with a pipette, taking care NOT to disturb the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5uuiq","text":"Add 1 ml of ddH20, vortex or resuspend with a pipette. Make sure that a homogenous suspension is achieved!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":15,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dn56a","text":"Centrifuge again for 1 min @ 13000 RPM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cch77","text":"Remove the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dut3r","text":"If the pellet is white\/grey without many erythrocytes, go on to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":78,"style":"align-left"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rl0b","text":"If the pellet is still red, repeat the washing step with ddH20 or PBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":69,"style":"align-left"},{"offset":60,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bqv8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10kub","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"style":"align-left"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"8l40h","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"style":"align-left"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4h246","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1sntg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3ss2rae.jpg","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3ss2rae.jpg","original_name":"pellet1.jpg","width":"185","height":"189","mime":null,"is_video":false}},{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3st2rae.jpg","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3st2rae.jpg","original_name":"pellet2.jpg","width":"151","height":"189","mime":null,"is_video":false}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18n7u","text":"Remove the supernatant gently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"49ji8","text":"Snap the bottom of the reaction tube with a finger and\/or vortex, so that the pellet does not adhere so firmly to the walls of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"805mo","text":"Add 10 drops of LY-A solution (comes with the RESIST-3 O.K.N.) and vortex. Make sure that a homogenous suspension is achieved (e.g. by vortexing or pipetting up and down).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"au96h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1f4g1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"798lh","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"84qop","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"sii7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"32vpg","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9qlsh","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e40qn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bps1g","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5geol","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3su2rae.jpg","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3su2rae.jpg","original_name":"suspension.jpg","width":"118","height":"180","mime":null,"is_video":false}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1hao","text":"Add 90 \u00b5l of the suspension in the sample field of the cassette test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2q8qq","text":"Incubate up to 15 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"748l1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5u5kp","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43qpp","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"4n531","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d1csi","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3sw2rae.jpg","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3sw2rae.jpg","original_name":"ICT-loading2.jpg","width":null,"height":null,"mime":null,"is_video":false}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e764i","text":"The test is valid if a red line appears at the position marked with 'C' (=control line).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm8h4","text":"OXA-48 isolates show an additional band at the position marked with 'O', KPC producing isolates at the position marked with 'K', NDM isolates at the position marked with 'N'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6pm3j","text":"OXA-48-like and KPC producing isolates usually show a positive reaction after 30s to 2 min, while NDM-producing isolates take longer (usually 2-7 min, sometimes up to 15 min). NDM bands are fainter than bands of OXA-48 or KPC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1k57g","text":"Any band appearing on the ICT within the maximum reading time of 15 min. should be regarded as positive!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":104,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"filc4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97h8u","text":"Tipps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":6,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ag0ae","text":"Some isolates have more than one carbapenemase. If a band has appeared at the position of KPC or OXA-48 after 1-2 min and you want to exclude the additional presence of an NDM carbapenemase, read the test a second time at 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"56v55","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4n1i8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ch49p","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"drssi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6ngn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"568hf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"imageblock","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":null,"source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3sz2rae.jpg","placeholder":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/3sz2rae.jpg","original_name":"comparisonResults.jpg","width":"538","height":"230","mime":null,"is_video":false}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"derj4","text":"Add 10 \u00b5l ZnSO4 solution and incubate in a heating block for 15 min. at 37\u00b0C, shaking at 300\/min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":14,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ji69","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1me8e","text":"(incubation at room temperature without shaking might be possible, but has not been extens","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dhj2b","text":"a","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"81di0","text":"ively tested)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"89mkk","text":" steps.section: Optional step - incubation with ZnSO4 for improved performance with NDM-producing Enterobacteriaceae (advanced protocol)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ea3km","text":"Test the ICT with several previously characterized isolates producing the carbapenemases OXA-48, KPC and NDM to get familiar with the test procedure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9oaqs","text":"If the pellet (or a large part thereof) is lost during washing\/centrifugation or if the pellet is too small from the beginning, repeat steps 1-4 to obtain a sufficiently large pellet before continuing with the protocol. \nIf the pellet (corresponding to the bacterial inoculum) is too small, false-negative results can occur, especially for NDM.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e0iea","text":"The short protocol (without step 2) works well for all OXA-48 and KPC and most NDM-producing Enterobacteriaceae. Some NDM-producing isolates give rise to very faint bands, which can be improved by the additional 15 min (or longer) incubation with ZnSO4 (advanced protocol). Zinc is a co-factor for metallo-beta-lactamases, such as NDM.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":251,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5bnd1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8mvt","text":"The assay has been assessed in a proof of principle study using spiked blood cultures.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d19hs","text":"For this purpose, 170 molecularly characterized Enterobacteriaceae isolates have been tested; of these, 126 produced a carbapenemase of the types NDM, OXA-48-like or KPC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f5a6i","text":"Sensitivity and specificity were 100%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fa0eo","text":"However, it has not been validated with clinical samples. Further studies are necessary to assess the performance of this test in routine diagnostics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
